oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews Moe Bandy
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Moe Bandy (performer) for Nashville's WSM. Recording is from May 18, 1982.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Moe Bandy
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Ralph Emery and Moe Bandy introduce the program and Ronnie Milsap's ""Any Day Now"" -- (00:25) Emery discusses Milsap's blindness -- (01:23) Emery invites Bandy to discuss his track and Bandy reflects on people's ignorance to past country artists -- (03:01) Emery recalls Carl Smith's dedication to touring -- (03:34) Bandy and Emery joke about Reba McEntire -- (03:50) Emery invites Bandy to discuss ""Only if There's Another You"", calling it a beautiful love song -- (04:52) Bandy reflects on golfing with Willie Nelson -- (07:02) Emery discusses the studio issues he recently had -- (07:53) Emery invites Bandy to discuss the time he hit someone with a golf ball -- (10:50) Bandy and Emery discuss the success of ""Hank Williams You Wrote My Life"" -- (12:14) Emery and Bandy discuss Bandy's handicap in golf and how active he is -- (14:40) Bandy and Emery reflect on ""Hey Joe"" -- (15:14) Emery and Bandy close the show -- (15:36) Emery and Bandy greet the crowd and both discuss ""On the Road Again"" -- (16:30) Bandy reflects on the first song that brought him success and working as a sheet metal worker -- (18:45) Emery has Bandy recall his story with Jimmy Carter -- (21:19) Bandy reflects on the career of Judy Bailey -- (22:44) ""Hank and Lefty Raised My Country Soul"" is introduced by Bandy -- (23:26) Emery and Bandy discuss the nickname the 'Jesus Christ of Country Music' -- (25:00) Bandy tells a story about a time a police officer recognized him -- (25:51) Emery invites Bandy to be the disc jockey -- (26:15) Emery tells Bandy about a story about an empty jukebox -- (26:37) Bandy and Emery discuss Bandy's family and Atkins, Texas -- (28:56) Bandy and Emery close out the show -- (29:22) Emery and Bandy joke about their upcoming schedules
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Bandy, Moe;
